sentences.en: A dishonest action like that will degrade you.
sentences.cn: 像这样不诚实的行为会使你降低身份.

sentences.en: A dishonest person is bound to meet with setbacks sooner or later.
sentences.cn: 不老实的人非碰钉子不可.

sentences.en: Beware of dishonest traders in the tourist areas.
sentences.cn: 在旅游区一定要谨防奸商。

sentences.en: Dishonest importers would be able to pocket the VAT collected from customers.
sentences.cn: 不诚实的进口商将会能够把从顾客那里收取的增值税据为己有。

sentences.en: Don't be too familiar with him; he's a dishonest man.
sentences.cn: 别与他交往过密, 他这人不诚实.

sentences.en: Don't lend yourself to such dishonest schemes.
sentences.cn: 别参与这种欺诈的勾当.

sentences.en: His dishonest behaviour came under severe censure.
sentences.cn: 他的不诚实行为受到了严厉指责.

sentences.en: Never keep company with dishonest persons.
sentences.cn: 不要与不诚实的人打交道.

sentences.en: People on welfare are wrongly seen as lazy or dishonest.
sentences.cn: 靠福利救济的人被误以为懒惰或不老实。

sentences.en: She often complains that he is dishonest.
The affairs of the nation have been abandoned to dishonest politicians.
sentences.cn: 治国大权已落入诡诈的政客手中.
这个不忠实的军官被革职.

sentences.en: The dishonest treasurer misappropriated the club funds.
sentences.cn: 那个不诚实的出纳员挪用了俱乐部的公款.

sentences.en: You have been dishonest with me.
You wronged him when you said that he was dishonest.
sentences.cn: 你说他不诚实是屈了他了.

trans.tran_cn: 不诚实的，不老实的，不正直的，狡猾的，阴险的，不可靠的
trans.tran_en: not honest, and so deceiving or cheating people
